medium: Pen and brown ink with brush and brown wash
creditline: Bequest of Dan Fellows Platt, Class of 1895
markings: Stamp in blue ink, on verso of mount lower left: D.F.P. [in circle] [Lugt 750a]

makers.displaydate: 1696–1770; born Venice, Italy; died Madrid, Spain
makers.displaymaker: Giovanni Battista Tiepolo, 1696–1770; born Venice, Italy; died Madrid, Spain

texts.textentryhtml:
Possibly until 1852, Count Algarotti-Corniani, Venice, Italy.

1852, bought by Cheney.

29 April, 1885, Cheney Sale, Sotheby’s, lot 1024.

14 July, 1914, Christie's, lot 49;

purchased by Parsons;

between 1922-1926, purchased by Dan Fellows Platt;

Bequeathed to Princeton University Art Museum

bibliography.boilertext: Sotheby, Wilkinson & Hodge. 1885. Catalogue of the collection of engravings, etchings & drawings of the late Edward Cheney, Esq., which will be sold by auction. 29 April - 5 May 1885, London.
bibliography.citation: Sotheby, Wilkinson & Hodge. 1885. Catalogue of the collection of engravings, etchings & drawings of the late Edward Cheney, Esq., which will be sold by auction. 29 April - 5 May 1885, London., p. 50, lot. 1024

bibliography.boilertext: Catalogue of valuable manuscripts and books: the property of the late Alexander Allan Webbe, Esq. of 19 Portland Place, W., including the Lady Nelson papers consisting of over two hundred autograph letters from Admiral Viscount Nelson to his wife, and other valuable documents relating to the same, (London: Christie, Manson & Woods, 1914).
bibliography.citation: Catalogue of valuable manuscripts and books: the property of the late Alexander Allan Webbe, Esq. of 19 Portland Place, W., including the Lady Nelson papers consisting of over two hundred autograph letters from Admiral Viscount Nelson to his wife, and other valuable documents relating to the same, (London: Christie, Manson & Woods, 1914)., lot. 49
